intro: Callisia monandra, commonly known as the silver velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light. Callisia monandra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
